edu.ucla.sspace.graph

Class SparseDirectedGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.graph.AbstractGraph<DirectedEdge,SparseDirectedEdgeSet>
      • edu.ucla.sspace.graph.SparseDirectedGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DirectedGraph<DirectedEdge>, Graph<DirectedEdge>, Serializable

    public class SparseDirectedGraph
extends AbstractGraph<DirectedEdge,SparseDirectedEdgeSet>
implements DirectedGraph<DirectedEdge>
    An implementation of DirectedGraph that uses a sparse backing representation. This implementation assumes that the total number of edges is less than the n2 possible, where n is the number of vertices.

    This class supports all optional Graph and DirectedGraph methods. All returned DirectedEdge-based collections will reflect the state of the graph and may be modified to change the graph; i.e., adding an edge to the adjacency list of a vertex or edge list of the graph will add that edge in the backing graph. Adding vertices by adding to the AbstractGraph.vertices() set is supported. Adding edges by adding a vertex to the set of adjacent vertex is not supported.

    Author:
    David Jurgens
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public DirectedGraph<DirectedEdge> copy(Set<Integer> vertices)
        Creates a copy of this graph containing only the specified number of vertices and all edges between those vertices. If vertices is empty a new, empty graph of this instance's type is returned. Any changes made to this graph will not be reflected in returned copy or vice-versa.

      • subgraph

        public DirectedGraph subgraph(Set<Integer> vertices)
        Returns a view of this graph containing only the specified vertices where the returned graph's vertinces are renamed (0, ..., n). This renaming is to ensure a conceptual distance between the "new" returned graph and the backing graph in terms of vertex labeling; for example, adding vertex n to the subgraph may not necessarily correspond to vertex n in the backing graph.

        Only edges connecting two vertices in the provided set will be viewable in the subgraph. Any changes to the subgraph will be reflected in this graph and vice versa.

        This view allows for direct manipulation of a part of the graph. For example, clearing this subgraph will remove all of its corresponding vertices and edges from the backing graph.

        Specified by:
        subgraph in interface DirectedGraph<DirectedEdge>
        Specified by:
        subgraph in interface Graph<DirectedEdge>
        Overrides:
        subgraph in class AbstractGraph<DirectedEdge,SparseDirectedEdgeSet>
        Parameters:
        vertices - the vertices to include in the subgraph

      • successors

        public IntSet successors(int vertex)
        Returns the set of vertices that can be reached by following the outgoing edges from this vertex.
        Specified by:
        successors in interface DirectedGraph<DirectedEdge>
